citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
One scarlet macaw has a severely overgrown beak that is crossed over to such an extent that it no longer allows for a
normal occlusion. Additionally, one hyacinth macaw has a moderately overgrown beak that has not yet impacted its
occlusion. Overgrown beaks may impact a bird's ability to eat and drink appropriately, which can be detrimental to their
health and well-being. The facility must establish and maintain programs of veterinary care that include the use of
appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose and treat diseases and injuries. The facility must inform the attending
veterinarian of these animals' conditions and following their guidance for treatment. Correct by June 5, 2025.

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Two red rumped parakeets exhibited severe head wounds that may be attributed to feather and skin plucking related to
breeding behavior. However, the extent of the head wounds was in excess of what is expected during normal pair
breeding, especially in the female bird. These wounds may be causing pain and distress and could render the birds
susceptible to skin infections.
Additionally, one parrotlet was observed during the inspection exhibiting labored breathing and puffed feathers. These
behaviors may indicate a severe underlying medical issue that requires immediate veterinary care.
The facility must ensure that daily observations are performed on all animals to assess their health and well-being and
communicate any problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being to the attending veterinarian in a timely manner.
The facility must correct this issue by informing the attending veterinarian of the animals' conditions and follow all
treatment plans as recommended by the attending veterinarian. To be corrected by June 5, 2025.

No records of acquisition were available for 1 hedgehog, 8 degus, and 2 red rumped parakeets. The facility must make,
keep, and maintain records which fully and correctly disclose the name and address of the person from whom the animals
were acquired, the date of purchase or acquisition, the species, and the numbers of the animals. To be corrected by June
18, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Tonya Hadjis, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist n

2.40(b)(2)  Direct
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
One scarlet macaw has a severely overgrown beak that is crossed over to such an extent that it no longer allows for a

2.40(b)(3)  Direct
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Two red rumped parakeets exhibited severe head wounds that may be attributed to feather and skin plucking related to 
breeding behavior. However, the extent of the head wounds was in excess of what is expected during normal pair

Additionally, one parrotlet was observed during the inspection exhibiting labored breathing and puffed feathers. These

The facility must ensure that daily observations are performed on all animals to assess their health and well-being and

The facility must correct this issue by informing the attending veterinarian of the animals' conditions and follow all

2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
No records of acquisition were available for 1 hedgehog, 8 degus, and 2 red rumped parakeets. The facility must make, 
keep, and maintain records which fully and correctly disclose the name and address of the person from whom the animals

were acquired, the date of purchase or acquisition, the species, and the numbers of the animals. To be corrected by June 
18, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Tonya Hadjis, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist n

species.common: CONGO AFRICAN GREY PARROT / GRAY PARROT
